Very nice, great location? Recommended
reviews.text: Stayed with my wife in a club room for 2 nights as part of a work conference. Room was small but well appointed and more than comfortable. I was worried about noise with our room facing the very busy Flinders St and being right across the road from the Flinders Street train station. However windows double glazed and did not need to be concerned. If you stay make sure you talk to staff about the pillow menu as IMHO regular pillows are hard and awful. Due to the "heritage" nature of room TV is small and showing its age; but suppose good incentive to get out and see the Melbourne sights. Breakfast was usual continental and buffet fare but good range and variety, and most importantly it was being freshly cooked and regularly restocked. Location is fantastic with most major sights either in easy walking distance or easily accessible via public transport. Tram and train stations are virtually adjacent. Staff were friendly and helpful with a number of requests. I recommend for an enjoyable stay in a heritage style venue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A basic hotel in a good location but not 4.5 stars. Stayed for 3 nights in July 2012 arrived after midnight to unfriendly check-in staff. Workers started banging just down from room at 7:15am next morning. Reception staff advised work all finished on our floor should be no more noise. Unfortunately he didn't know the housekeeping staff who call to each other at 7:30am while "working". Room service dishes were left outside rooms all day and in the late evening collected and piled up in service area - not a good or hygienic look. Room only half cleaned and tea coffee not restocked.
reviews.title: Great location, serviceable but not a 4.5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel early, and we were met by a super helpful and friendly staff member named Jaime. She was in training, but was very helpful. They were unable to check us in early, but they did put a priority clean on our room and held our bags for us so we could go out on the town. She also rang my mobile about 2 hours later saying our room was ready and the bags had been dropped off. When we arrived at our room, we thought it to be pretty average, having a window looking out to a concrete wall. But hey, this is Melbourne and I kinda expected at so no bother. The bathroom was really tiny (But I expected this in an older hotel ) so it was no hassle. The only complaint I had about the room was the very dark decor with very minimal lighting. Please do not be afraid to use the mini bar, most them I avoid, but this one is very reasonably priced! The pillow concierge was a huge bonus for my wife as she needed a special pillow, and one was brought within moments of asking for it! The hotel itself is located almost adjacent to a city circle tram stop, making it easy to take the free tram around the free loop! Overall, I would say this is a very nice place to stay, the staff are super and are only to eager to assist you.
reviews.title: Great location, super staff, rooms.. so so
